common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Performance Issues and Freezes
common_issues.description: Users report performance issues, including slowdowns and crashes, primarily on macOS, often associated with Long Term Memory (LTM) feature.  Freezes occur after periods of inactivity, especially following chat interactions, on both macOS and Windows.  Users have tried restarting the application and checking for updates, but issues persist. Further investigation into LTM's impact on system resources and potential conflicts with different operating systems is needed.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.
related_issues.text: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset. ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.3.6 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop keeps crashing
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop keeps crashing
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Invalid Discord Invite Links
common_issues.description: Multiple reports indicate invalid Discord invite links across the Pieces website, documentation, and Pieces OS app.  Users are encountering expired or incorrect links. A permanent, non-expiring link should be created and updated across all platforms.

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid on the website
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Marketing Site (pieces.app)

### Operating System / Platform

Web

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The main Pieces website [page](<https://pieces.app>) offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/106f7b8e-0f74-4efa-a6ec-9cfe48133198)

The support [page](<https://docs.pieces.app/products/support>) of Pieces documentation website offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.com/invite/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87064aff-9a18-420f-bb9f-a86e358e3dea)

Both of the above Discord invite links are invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace all those.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Crashing/Freezing
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app crashing or freezing across macOS and Windows. One user noted crashes linked to Long Term Memory (LTM) 2.5. Another reported freezing after inactivity, especially after chat interaction with LTM enabled. A third user experienced crashes when Chrome tabs have extensive content (e.g., long logs).  Issues occur across different Pieces OS versions (11.4.0-11.4.2).

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Issues with LTM
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces Desktop related to LTM, including incorrect date/time display, crashes (macOS), and freezing after inactivity (Windows).  Copilot chat sometimes generates unrelated topics even with context provided. Issues appear across different Pieces OS versions (11.4.1, 11.4.2) and Desktop versions. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After I did all my work with LTM turned on, I used the `Start Copilot Chat` button in the **Workstream Activity** View of Pieces Desktop. I asked it to generate some quiz questions based on what I studied, and it started talking about a lot of unrelated topics, even when the context was provided. Though when I started a new chat based on the context again and became more specific with the details such as lecture name and number (that was the one and only thing in the context I started the conversation with), it did it correctly. Also, all this while, the context time showed Last Thursday so I think there is an UI bug too. 

**Context Image:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab732ff6-d195-4e81-a2af-6cee1e1d2032)

**Chat Image (Where it talks about unrelated topics):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6abd44-60a0-4f0c-9f8a-1cf1a887fd2e)

**Chat Image (Where it was fixed):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7d86c81-ba0e-4ec3-8e2f-49a326ac232a)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2: Slow or no response to chat and image pasting issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow or no responses when using chat features in the Pieces OS 11.4.2 Desktop Application on Windows.  Pasting images results in "Uuups..." errors.  Issues occur with GPT 4.1 and potentially other integrations.  One user mentioned a 5-minute delay or no response at all across multiple applications (VS2022, VS Code, Desktop app).

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Discord link issue due to its high activity level and simple fix.
Investigate and address Pieces Desktop crashes/freezes, especially those related to LTM, across macOS and Windows.
Improve Pieces OS 11.4.2 chat responsiveness and image pasting functionality.
Address Pieces Desktop performance issues, particularly on macOS, focusing on LTM's impact.
Monitor and address issues related to Pieces Copilot chat context and date accuracy.
Review and optimize Pieces OS and Desktop app resource usage to mitigate performance issues and crashes.
Ensure consistent communication with users regarding ongoing investigations and updates on reported issues.
Improve error handling and messaging within Pieces OS and Desktop app (e.g., replace "Uuups..." with more descriptive errors).
Consider adding more detailed logging to aid in debugging and troubleshooting user-reported issues.
Proactively monitor application performance and stability across different operating systems and configurations.
Implement automated testing to catch regressions and ensure software quality before releases.
Create a dedicated internal channel for tracking and prioritizing bug fixes and feature requests based on user feedback and activity levels.

Consider implementing a user forum or community platform to facilitate peer-to-peer support and knowledge sharing.
